guide.conclusion:
This is the perfect use of an old sweatshirt or a baby blanket and some felt you may have lying around.

Choose soft fabrics for the main body. and soft fabric that will not fray for the details.

guide.introduction:
Not all Halloween's are spooky and ghouly some are sugar and spice. And to ward away the scary sometimes you just need a little something special.

This year my 3 yr old announced he wanted the entire family to dress up as characters from his favorite book, Fox In Socks. Not picking that up in a department store anytime soon! Of all the costumes I made, Sue with Slow Joe Crow is my favorite. I think Slow Joe Crow came out amazing. And here is how to do it! More importantly, this is how to draft the pattern for a stuffed animal.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Not all Halloween's are spooky and ghouly some are sugar and spice. And to ward away the scary sometimes you just need a little something special.

This year my 3 yr old announced he wanted the entire family to dress up as characters from his favorite book, Fox In Socks. Not picking that up in a department store anytime soon! Of all the costumes I made, Sue with Slow Joe Crow is my favorite. I think Slow Joe Crow came out amazing. And here is how to do it! More importantly, this is how to draft the pattern for a stuffed animal.

Relevant parts
  • 1/2 yard black fabric
  • 1/4 yard dark blue fabric
  • 4 pipe cleaners
  • small amount of gray fabric or felt
  • embrodiery floss
  • stuffing; polyfil, wool, bamboo, hemp
Tools
  • basic sewing tools (thread, scissors, pins)
  • fabric marking pencil or white crayon ^_^
  • fray check, optional
  • paper, pencil, other drawing materials
  • sewing needle or sewing machine

parts.text: small amount of gray fabric or felt

lines.text: This is the most time consuming part of the process. Study the drawing or image you want. Start sketching the character until you are happy with the way it looks. You will need to sketch front, side, and perhaps the back. This will be the basis of your pattern.
lines.text_raw: This is the most time consuming part of the process. Study the drawing or image you want. Start sketching the character until you are happy with the way it looks. You will need to sketch front, side, and perhaps the back. This will be the basis of your pattern.

lines.text: If you have made a pin cushion...or if you have seen a pattern for a pin cushion, you can use that for an idea of how to go about this. If you want fatter draw wider along the center line. Also keep in mind the head can be done in various ways, circle, square, triangle. I chose triangle to give the flatness to the front of the face in order to mount the beak while giving a roundness to the back of the head.

lines.text: Once happy with your drawing, label and cut out each piece. If you are hand sewing add ¼ inch and if you are machine sewing add ½ inch to your pattern. This picture does not have the seam allowance added.
